subject: Languages
title: Did All Languages Start from One? The Quest for Proto-World
description: A quick, practical guide to Did All Languages Start from One? The Quest for Proto-World.

hook.text: Could every human language descend from a single ancestor spoken by the first modern humans in Africa?

discovery.text: Some researchers point to possible shared roots: 'mama' for mother appears in unrelated languages worldwide.

twist.text: But mainstream linguists say we can't reconstruct further back than about 10,000 years â€” the signal decays.

climax.text: Languages change so fast that ancient connections are erased â€” like footprints washed away by waves.

punchline.text: We all came from Africa. Whether our languages did too may never be known.

quiz.question: Why do most linguists doubt the Proto-World hypothesis?
options: Languages change too fast to reconstruct connections beyond about 10,000 years
There's no evidence humans ever lived in Africa
The hypothesis was disproven by DNA evidence
